UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that may represent a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: Identification of Novel Cryptic Multifunctional Antimicrobial Peptides from the Human Stomach Enabled by a Computational-Experimental Platform.
Literature.Author: Pane K, Cafaro V, Avitabile A, Torres MT, Vollaro A, De Gregorio E, Catania MR, Di Maro A, Bosso A, Gallo G, Zanfardino A, Varcamonti M, Pizzo E, Di Donato A, Lu TK, de la Fuente-Núnez C, Notomista E

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MIC=6.25µM),Escherichia coli ATCC 35218(MIC=6.25µM),Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium ATCC 14028(MIC=6.25µM),Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Enteritidis 706 RIVM(MIC=6.25µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa RP73(MIC=6.25µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1(MIC=6.25µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MIC=12.5µM),Acinetobacter baumannii ATCC 17878(MIC=1.56µM),Klebsiella pneumoniae ATCC 700603(MIC=6.25µM),Enterococcus faecalis ATCC 29212(MIC=12.5µM),Listeria monocytogenes(MIC=>50µM),Staphylococcus aureus WKZ2(MIC=6.25µM),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 6538P(MIC=1.56µM),Bacillus subtilis ATCC 6633(MIC=12.5µM)
